reviewText:
Early Access Review

Is this game in Alpha? Yes.
Are there some bugs? Probably, but I can't find them at the moment.
Do I like this game? Yes.

(TL:DR or if you just don't want to read it: This game is awesome, get it.)

Facts about the game:
It's in development. You can vote on the things that go into the game. (Heck yes)
Basically the whole game revolves around capital ship combat. Each ship has specific bonuses that allow players to have different playstyles. If you try to have a playstyle that doesn't fit your ship, it wont take too long to see it. Trial and error is one of your best friends in this game. Don't be worried about losing ships at the start. (However, each time you lose a ship in game increases the respawn time - up to a point) Also, don't worry about losing a game. No matter what, you gain experience and credits. Experience in a specific company's ships allows you to spend those experience points to unlock more advanced ships from that manufacturer. Now there are also ship loadouts that you can modify, which also cost manufacturer experience to unlock, and credits to buy. Once again, it's another way to tweak your ship to fit your exact playstyle.

I really REALLY like this game, and am excited to see where it's going to go. I like being able to see the development progress before my eyes and see the awesomeness unfold. There's a lot of players for something in the alpha stage, and I can always find people online. It does have a bit of a steep learning curve, especially if you don't look at the controls.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo far I am still new to the game and trying to find my footing but I really enjoy the experience. The graphics are superb and the game seems to be very playable". The developers are doing an excellent job and the game is amazingly mature for an "Alpha" release. I have already recommended it to others and will continue to do so. I look forward to having more "throttle" time on the game!"

Early Access Review

The game feels meaty for an early access game. The classes are only in need of minor tweaking and there is rarely a feeling of being unfairly beaten.
The slower pace of the game makes teamwork all the more important with come from behind victories possible and individual performances still critical.
Well balanced teams are the key here, I'm looking forward to expansions, more content and extra features. This game is still worth a play even in early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far I have really enjoyed playing this game, particularily the larger ships like the leviathon and destroyer. Definately recommend this game to anyone who likes space.
I do think there needs to be some changes to HP for some ships, especially the cloaked ships and sniper.  A ship that has devestating alpha, can cloak, has decent speed, and 2000 more base HP than the fast ships that would be hunting them seems slightly unbalanced to me.  Don't get me wrong, I love playing them but they are just don't have enough weaknesses for the role they are filling.
Sniper ship also needs less HP and its guns should have slower movement(not too much slower but a sniper shouldnt be able to follow a frigate 5km away(and to the side) and hit every time.  Think a tank destroyer in world of tanks vs a fast medium or light.  They can hit but it's much harder.
I think the Carrier damage rating should be reduced 1 point as well.  It really is more of a support/defensive ship and even in close range with max upgrades(vs a max upgrade opponent) it doesnt seem to match the offensive output indicated by its rating.  Just to be clear, I think the damage is fine(but I wouldn't complain if there were a few more bombers per wing) but that it doesn't seem to meet the current offensive rating from what I've found.
These current specs are not game breaking by any means and pilot skill usually always wins but I do feel these are relatively easy fixes that would help game balance.

It feels very MOBA-esque, but would be nice if they added some more maps and maybe some sort of creep-wave? The good news is the developers seem to take player feedback into consideration.

TL;DR: Space ships go zoooooom, pew pew pew, and BOOM BOOM BOOM!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game seriously deserves more than 76% positive ratings. For an alpha game, the graphics on the ships are flawless, and trust me, only having 1 map doesn't make the game tedious since the fun doesn't come from pretty scenery, it comes from great plays and battles. It's a complicated rock-papers-scissors that requires coordination and strategy even if the idea is simple.

My only gripe is the tech and upgrade trees, how one has to unlock a certain ship or ability when their end goal is a different ship or ability. The ships and abilities are sidegrades anyways, fitting your playstyle so why not be able to directly unlock the ship/ability you want?

Overall, a wonderful game that's only going to get better. One worth sinking your harpoon (yes you heard me right) into.

I've just gotten the game this last week, and as much as I love it, I can't help feel there's a massive imbalance going down.

I mean I'm only a lvl 2, (Don't Laugh).. and I'm being pitted against players that have Lasers that slice through your dam ship & they seem to zip across the battle space lol, no wonder I'm getting a kicking.

I guess this just means I'll have to buckle up & keep upgrading, though I'm sure Noobs such as myself can be pitted with a matching class.

However, all being said, I still love the game & will keep upgrading, you can also spend cash to help speed shti up.
From what I've seen, there are a few playing it like this, and if you like to stay ahead, Then you will have to spend a little cash getting there, though you could still play for FREE if you wanted.

Great Graphics, excellent scenes, Wicked Sounds, Great Space Battles.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI haven't played this in some time because it could be so brutal because of the matchmaking problems but when it was good it was great. It wasn't the Dev's fault really. It was the fault of people who like to stack the odds in their favor by stacking their teams. The amount these Devs work on trying to make this the most balanced space PvP Arena out there shows they know what their game's weakness is and they really want it to be a great experience everytime. I was tempted to give a bad review but I have waited and over the last 6 months and I have seen a laser sharp focus on matchmaking so I am giving them a good review. The game looks amazing and the gameplay I would say is tanks in space. It can be slow and very tactical but when you meet it is a brawl like no other game can provide.

I don't even know where to start about this game.
You may call it World of Spaceships if you want, because it is very similar to War Thunder, World of Planes and World of Tanks.
Rounds:
Basically, you play rounds like in all of the mentioned games, but here you conquer lanes" and mines that produce resources that allows your team to upgrade their ship lvl. You win the game by capturing the enemy base and you can jump to it only from a lane with point thats closer to oponents base captured.

Hangar
recommended: there is tech tree here. After winning or loosing the game
hoursPlayed:
you're awarded with 2 types of resources (i cant remember the names). Like in WoT and other games of that kind you use one to research an item and the other to purchase it afterwards. Ships are unlocked and upgraded the same way.

Ships:
There are few ship "classes" and few manufacturers. All of the ships are usefull in their own way and incredibly balanced

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far I have spent a few hours on this game and I have to say it is really good fun with or without friends. While I usually play with people I know, when I go on by myself I still have a good time. The ships currently in game are really good fun to use and it doesn't take that long to get the ship you want, be it the Leviathan or the Infilitrator.

While the matchmaking doesn't fully work and at times it can take a while to load, the gameplay from it is very enjoyable, with two current game modes I am still satisfided with the variety in the game cuased by different ships and team members creating different scenarios.

Locking down a lane as a Gladiator or sneaking behind the enemy as the Assassin both are fun in their own ways and I recomended this game to anyone intreseted in having either brawls in massive capitals or a quick hit-&-run on the enemy.

It's a complicated rock-papers-scissors that requires coordination and strategy even if the idea is simple.

My only gripe is the tech and upgrade trees, how one has to unlock a certain ship or ability when their end goal is a different ship or ability. The ships and abilities are sidegrades anyways, fitting your playstyle so why not be able to directly unlock the ship/ability you want?

Overall, a wonderful game that's only going to get better. One worth sinking your harpoon (yes you heard me right) into.

I've just gotten the game this last week, and as much as I love it, I can't help feel there's a massive imbalance going down.

I mean I'm only a lvl 2, (Don't Laugh).. and I'm being pitted against players that have Lasers that slice through your dam ship & they seem to zip across the battle space lol, no wonder I'm getting a kicking.

I guess this just means I'll have to buckle up & keep upgrading, though I'm sure Noobs such as myself can be pitted with a matching class.

However, all being said, I still love the game & will keep upgrading, you can also spend cash to help speed shti up.
From what I've seen, there are a few playing it like this, and if you like to stay ahead, Then you will have to spend a little cash getting there, though you could still play for FREE if you wanted.

Great Graphics, excellent scenes, Wicked Sounds, Great Space Battles.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI haven't played this in some time because it could be so brutal because of the matchmaking problems but when it was good it was great. It wasn't the Dev's fault really. It was the fault of people who like to stack the odds in their favor by stacking their teams. The amount these Devs work on trying to make this the most balanced space PvP Arena out there shows they know what their game's weakness is and they really want it to be a great experience everytime. I was tempted to give a bad review but I have waited and over the last 6 months and I have seen a laser sharp focus on matchmaking so I am giving them a good review. The game looks amazing and the gameplay I would say is tanks in space. It can be slow and very tactical but when you meet it is a brawl like no other game can provide.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's fun but game balance needs a serious re-work.
For example, the Carrier is completely useless unless you have all of your teammates shooting the same target (i.e. its alpha damage is too low to be of any use, much solo a corvette).
Carrier also has abhorrent tank for being a capital. For some reason a Hunter (generally squishy with medium dps) with no assist from support ships or gas power can solo a carrier who is throwing literally every single fighter he has at it and smashing his left click, useless pencil beam. The only good thing about carriers is it's immense fighter control range. Being able to send bombers to an enemy ship the second they jump in is nice, but the damage sucks and they just die to point defense anyway.

But above all that, it has a lot of fun brawling that goes on, which is always a plus. So it still keeps the fun factor, but there are some serious balancing issues that should be addressed. I reccomend it to anyone who likes space-y grinder games and space battles. And the grind for ships is really not bad at all. You can get to the highest current tier in a couple of hours, but keep in mind too that this game is still new and young, so there's a limited amount of tiers/ships. But a rework of the damages accross the board would be nice.

8/10 for fun and repeat factors, but due to imbalance on some ship classes it can cause some irritation, especially when flying the carrier.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Love this game!


-Diverse ships: each has a type of ship it is really good against and a ship type it is really bad against (based off of one-on-one) and as the game keeps being developed more ships are added with different load-out options (usually a standard, faster firing speed but lower damage, and a high damage but lower firing speed).

-Each battle is different: every ship has a counter and a ship to compliment it. For examble; most small ships can be taken out by a Colossus, but a Destroyer or Reaper can tear through a Colossus' armor and destroy it.

-The game is very basic after you play a couple times: The controls are easy to learn, all your ship functions are layed out for you in the order that the abilities are on the keyboard/mouse, and after a match or two you begin to understand the role of what your ship is and how it fits into how to make your team the victor. Each ship has different abilities, roles, speeds, and differences which can help win an engagement.

-They actively update it. This isn't an alpha game that sits, the devs actively improve ships, environments, and listen to their player base.

This is a good game. Get it if you think you'll enjoy a 5v5 capital ship game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fractured Space is a Free to Play PVP space combat game.  All 5vs5 PVP and skill based. Needs teamwork, communication, and luck to win. Team-based space combat simulator from Edge Case Games, where you and four other capital ships work together to outwit, outmaneuver, and outgun the enemy squadron, seize their territory, and win.

It is in Early Access so it will be buggy, rough, missing features, lopsided battles.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very fun 3rd person shooter MOBA set in gee dee space y'all! It's very tactical, since the ships move and die slowly. It has a great balance of mechanics to keep you hopping around the battlefield trying to push, grab Gamma (which gives a combat buff), and push on base.

It's in alpha at the time of writing this review, so there are bugs abound. But, surprisingly playable despite matchmaking connection issues, lag, and other bugs.


PROS:
Very tactical, teamwork > individual skill
Ships have different playstyles/roles
Excellent graphics (except Gamma and Bases, which I believe are stand in models)
ECG is very transparent with their development model, and even allows voting on certain gameplay issues
In game boosters are used when YOU want to use them (they double the XP or credits earned on a single battle)
Friendly community

CONS:
Lots of disconnects right now
Lagginess
Ship unlocks are still being developed

Honestly, I hate to put those cons in there, since it is Alpha, but just to inform anyone wanting to get this game... there are still quality of life issues.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Just wanted to clarify in an updated review that this game is NOT PAY TO WIN for those of you looking at getting it.  For some reason, people see cash shop skins, the ability to pay for half (and ONLY half) of the progression, and the prefix premium" on certain ships and then come here screaming pay to win.

To keep it short
date: premium ships are the exact same as their counterpart (EG:  The Phantom Ghost is a reskinned Ghost
recommended: the Revenant Reaper is a reskinned Reaper) save for their appearance.  The major difference is that they can only be obtained during events or when purchasing the Vanguard pack
hoursPlayed: and that they look slightly different.  In addition
voteText: they come with fixed loadouts meaning they don't have the same options as their counterparts

column17: LoL

column21: 2015 @ 1:36pm\n\nI absolutely love the game
column23: it's not very optimized yet. As a result
column24: low end computers like mine can barely keep up. (Especially when a Flagship is shooting its flak everywhere.) Over the last few months
column25: there has been quite a lot of improvements/additions to the game
column26: so hopefully optimization is on their list.\n\nNow a little about the game: It's basically a capital ship battle MOBA. There are 2 lanes
column27: each with 2 large bases at either end of the lane (each owned by a different team at the start)
column28: and 3 resource bases in between both bases. There is also a gas facility in the center of the map that becomes available a few minutes in that gives temporary combat bonuses such as rate of fire
column30: similar to the old Baron in LoL.\n\nThe pacing of the game can vary just as much as other moba games. Short
column31: very one sided matches can last less than 20 minutes
column32: while the more common close matches can last upwards of 40 minutes.\n\nI paid $15 for the game for early access and other mostly cosmetic bonuses and I definitely do not regret it. However
column33: if you don't want to pay for the game and you want early access
column34: download it during a free weekend (like the weekend I'm writing this) and you get to keep it.\n\nIn conclusion: I love space games
column35: and I love competitive games. This game has both. As a free to play game
column36: I definitely recommend you try this game.\n"

column21: 2015 @ 1:36pm\n\nI absolutely love the game

column26: so hopefully optimization is on their list.\n\nNow a little about the game: It's basically a capital ship battle MOBA. There are 2 lanes
column27: each with 2 large bases at either end of the lane (each owned by a different team at the start)
column28: and 3 resource bases in between both bases. There is also a gas facility in the center of the map that becomes available a few minutes in that gives temporary combat bonuses such as rate of fire
column30: similar to the old Baron in LoL.\n\nThe pacing of the game can vary just as much as other moba games. Short
column31: very one sided matches can last less than 20 minutes
column32: while the more common close matches can last upwards of 40 minutes.\n\nI paid $15 for the game for early access and other mostly cosmetic bonuses and I definitely do not regret it. However
column33: if you don't want to pay for the game and you want early access
column34: download it during a free weekend (like the weekend I'm writing this) and you get to keep it.\n\nIn conclusion: I love space games
column35: and I love competitive games. This game has both. As a free to play game
column36: I definitely recommend you try this game.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's fun but game balance needs a serious re-work.
For example, the Carrier is completely useless unless you have all of your teammates shooting the same target (i.e. its alpha damage is too low to be of any use, much solo a corvette).
Carrier also has abhorrent tank for being a capital. For some reason a Hunter (generally squishy with medium dps) with no assist from support ships or gas power can solo a carrier who is throwing literally every single fighter he has at it and smashing his left click, useless pencil beam. The only good thing about carriers is it's immense fighter control range. Being able to send bombers to an enemy ship the second they jump in is nice, but the damage sucks and they just die to point defense anyway.

But above all that, it has a lot of fun brawling that goes on, which is always a plus. So it still keeps the fun factor, but there are some serious balancing issues that should be addressed. I reccomend it to anyone who likes space-y grinder games and space battles. And the grind for ships is really not bad at all. You can get to the highest current tier in a couple of hours, but keep in mind too that this game is still new and young, so there's a limited amount of tiers/ships. But a rework of the damages accross the board would be nice.

8/10 for fun and repeat factors, but due to imbalance on some ship classes it can cause some irritation, especially when flying the carrier.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I have played this game A LOT.
And it is a very good one in my opinion.
I don't get all the hate lately. Most of it is due to angry kids, not getting everything at once for free or confusing facts.

Pros:

- Real money only buys you exclusive cosmetics in this game. EVERYTHING else is achieveable with ingame money. I didn't spend a dollar on this game for progress.

Real money also buys:

: Boosters (they will double your XP or Credits after one round. But you can get them through rng drop pods after playing a couple of games)

: You could buy a ship with Platinum (real money  currency) instead of credits. BUT it would be expensive and you also have to pay with XP for the ship, which isn't buyable with real money. So most likely you have enough credits after getting enough XP for one ship.

IT ISN'T PAY TO WIN!

- Higher tier ships aren't better than the starter ships. In fact the starter ships are very powerful. The higher tier is just more complex to play and imho more fun. They try to balance every ship the same. So you don't need the most expensive ship to win.

- Every ship has it's own style to play with. So it is very different and brings a lot of depth to the game.

- You can't win this game on your own. You have to play as a team and you have to communicate. If you don't do that you are doomed and more experienced players will turn from helpful to salty. So if you are new and you red this: Please play as a team and have an eye out for your mates. Let people help you.

- Graphics are good and there are a lot of visual improvements with most updates.

- Long term fun.

- You can play as a team up to 3 in public matches. Which will get raised when there are enough people to play against as a premade team. So it doesn't screw the balance too bad.

- There is a shooting range so you can try any ship before grinding for it.

- 2 game modes. Conquest that takes a little longer (25-50 minutes depending on the teams and balance). And Frontline, which is fast paced and gives you a random ship out of all ships and will provide a big battle arena (just one lane) in which you have to win in 12 minutes. After that it is sudden death.

- People are in general friendly if you treat them the same. Even though the climate in the lower brackets seems to be a little more salty.

- Devs are super responsive. They read the forums every day and provide as much help as possible and give answers directly. Also they are taking a lot of criticism and suggestions into the game to improve it for the community.
Their balance is ongoing and when they messed something up they try to fix it fast.

- There are monthly updates with a lot of content (new ships, new gameplay features, etc.)

- It is free and no money grab. So why not play it guys?! Go get the game.


Cons:

- Small player base. Matchmaking takes up to 10 minutes in off peak hours. And then the balance is somewhat messed up, for experienced players have to play with new ones. Which isn't much fun for both sides.
In peak hours it is more like 3 minutes. Which is OK.

- The grind is very big. You need to play A LOT to unlock everything (which isn't really necessary, for there are no better ships" in general). But it could be frustrating.

- For the time being if a player disconnects you don't get a new team member. They have to reconnect to the match. Or else it would be 4 vs. 5.
The disconnected players can't get into a new game until their left one is finished though..."

Once again I cannot stree enough that this game is a Moba.
Treated like one it's an amazingly unique experience to the genre.

As a self proclaimed moba addict I can see this one going in my games for time spent."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, great graphics, great physix, great gameplay, gre... well, the list goes on doesn't it?

A friend of mine convinced me to buy the Early Access version of this and it's not too shabby, I enjoy playing it now and then with a couple of friends. The graphics just look great but the optimization of the entire game is just not there yet.

Good highlights about the game :
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

=Good gameplay, you will love shooting apart your enemies' ships.
=Balanced, this game is extremelly balanced and won't even get you mad if someone blows your ship up. You ALWAYS walk away with kills!
=Great graphics for an early access client.

Bad highlights about the game:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

=Sparse servers with a low playerbase, partially because it is still in Early Access(Not even alpha yet).
=No real tutorials, the game just throws you in expecting you to learn everything by yourself, I learned everything in an hour, so no worries here.
=Poor optimization. The game is still in Alpha so expect optimization, I mean come on... I bet you guys played Rust or The Forest once it came out, ran like crap eh?

A definite thumbs up for this game from me!
I expect future patches and optimization to improve overall gameplay! :D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played a few dozen matches and have loved this game so far. The ships look great and are detailed, the weapons are varied, the matches are interesting and dynamic.

There are different ways to win, and even though blind pick is a little annoying, they are looking to fix that to bring more mix into the game.

The game is young, but I'm amazed at how complete it feels in it's current state. There was a HUGE update (that some poeple weren't happy about, I'm okay with it) last week and development shows NO sign of stopping. We get teased all the time, and the devs are super friendly/stream multiple days per week.

No other game has gotten me into the development process like this, I love it! Now that this game is F2P (and it truly is), I HIGHLY RECOMMEND trying this game out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game just before their first “free weekend”, and found quickly that it is a challenging game that is constantly in the process of evolving. As an early-access Alpha, the growing community had direct input into how the game evolves, the feedback of the players directly impacting the direction of the game developers. This process proves that the game developers care about what their players have to say, and are building the game around the community, instead of trying to build a community around the game.

The game itself does have a small learning curve as there are numerous ships and play styles, along with more complicated tactics and strategies that are always evolving, but it’s well worth it to put in the time and effort necessary to master these skills. With more than 40 hours invested in this game, I still feel like I’m learning new things and tweaking my playstyle constantly in order to find new competitive edges.

Buyers keep in mind that the game is early-access, so not everything is perfect and polished yet, it is only an Alpha build, but its on a good track. What is currently available looks good, sounds good, and plays well. I’d recommend buying and buying now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It looks like Star Conflict.
It sounds like Smite.
It plays like World of Tanks.
Its what you always imagined Space Combat would be and look like in Eve Online.

Now I personally got into the game and saw the map and went, awe ♥♥♥♥, not another MOBA... ♥♥♥♥ing things are everywhere!  But no, its quite a bit more interesting than that... Its more than just pushing up your own lane - its feels more like sector based combat/capture the flag or tug of war rather than just blowing up towers to get to the other side.

Really interesting ideas here reminds me of WoT, make sure you angle your armor correctly and keep spinning to show new sides of armor, because if you get shot in the same place, you lose plating and die faster, but if you keep spinning you can really make the most out of your EHP - interesting idea.

Game looks spectacular, and when you see your buddies shooting other people with lasers flying by you go, damn, wish Eve was like this (Been playing Eve not via steam since 2010), so its very visualy pleasing.

Try the game out - I'll definately come back to this.  Unfortunately, little lag spikes (On part of my GPU I imagine) discourages me from playing much online (Don't want to be that guy who lags out), but progression system seems WoT-Star Conflict like, and you havea lot of neat research and abilities to use so...

Just give it a try already.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access Review:

Played about 7-8h of this today...

TL;DR - its a fun, well built moba, with room for more maps and ships to keep people interested. currently there is only the 1 map, but it is solid. (kinda like Rift is to LoL)

PROs:
-3 'starter' ships, 1 of each faction, each feels and handles totally differently and has a different roll.
-Leaning the roll of your ship means you have a better idea of how to engage/not engage nme fleets (as a frigate i now know how to reliably kill a flagship 1v1, as a corvette, i know its suicide to 1v1 anything other than a sniper.)
-just because you are hidiously out tonned doesnt mean you are helpless, it just means you have a significantly less forgiving fleet that needs to fight smart to win.
-The map is crazy fun once you understand how it works and how to navagate it.
-jumping = hidiously vulnarable, knowing when to jump is critical to winning. (more so when you play big slow ships like the flagship, destroyer, or even the reaper honestly (feels kinda tubby for an 'attack ship')
-its free! (atm...)

CONs:
-no key binding info in game, or any way to easily change it. (how many times have i ment to go down and jumped to Gamma... ugh)
-what the hell are upgrades?!
(ANS: it's your ship leveling up after your tream gains resources for those things you cap'd that dont seem to do anything. its automatic once you capture a base, you then need to 'heal' , read: sit at a base to recover health, and you will notice your hp max has gone up.)
-looks like a rip off of Dreadnaught which im really anxious to play.. but whatever, right?
-no real balance between the factions.. the corvette tree has 2.. 'ok' ships.. the hunter tree has 2 awesome ships, and the flagship tree has all the REALLY NEAT ships (sniper, cloaker, ultra tank, and also the most OP close range brawler in the game... the 'brawler' - its ♥♥♥♥in evil. not that all the other ships cant be evil, but this one will tear your bowels out if you let it close. DO. NOT. SOLO.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my first time writing a review for a game, but with me talking about it constantly and having put 140 hours into it, I guess it's the best game for me to write a review on.

The main thing i love about the game is the variety in how the ships play. Unlike other games, you can't buy one ship and overpower everyone by just buying the most expensive ship. They all have their strengths and weaknesses, and your play style must adapt to what ship you have and what situation you are in.

They all have distinctive weapons, sounds, looks, and abilities.

There's no many good space combat games out there, so I believe it would be safe to say that this is the best in it's category.
Now, that's not to say that it's absolutely perfect.

While they have had patches and updates, the matchmaking is flawed. Because of the slim amount of players, they can't quite match everyone up by rank. This somtimes ends up pitting newer players into more skilled people. Another issue from the lack of players is that it can be a pain to find a match, god forbid its late at night.

But if you're looking for a space combat game that isnt pay to win, has good graphics and gameplay, this is the game  you want. It's a bit of a learning curve to get used to having to position and maneuver your ship to keep your armor between you and the other ship as well as your guns, but once you get past that and learn how the enemy ships work, this game can be a blast.

Out of all the games i've played, i'd have to recommend this the strongest.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was going to post a long review but apparently Steam can't handle that and gives no error message for too many characters.

Pros:
Good graphics
Decent ships
Solid gameplay

Cons:
Microtransactions in an EA game
Awful netcode
Buggy matchmaking
Long grind
Incomplete tech trees
Awful starter ships, except the Sentinel in TDS
Experience points being exclusive to that specific manufacturer
One map, one game mode
No AI for flexibility in what you want to play

Game needs lots of work. You can only play with two people online at a time in a party, probably for balancing issues, but the balancing sucks in-game anyway. The matchmaking is horribly bad, and the lag can get really bad, too. My ping in any other game is great, but this one? Nah.

Would I recommend it? Not right now. Hopefully when they put a bit more work into it down the line it'll definitely be worth playing. Plenty of potential, but a lot of it is wasted at the moment. Plus, it's solid enough to not be early access simply from a gameplay and bug perspective.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is very much a fall from grace. I played it a few months ago during the free weekened and liked it so much I wanted to keep it. I then convinced my roomates to get it, and we had a blast. But eventually the lack of content and the slow grind made me grow a bit tired kinda soon. Still liked it, but I needed a break. A few months later I came back, only to be slapped in the face repeatedly by a broken UI full of glitches and a queue system that wouldn't allow me to get in any game time. The poor matchmaking is nothing new, to be honest. It took forever for me to get in a match without getting disconected from the server every few seconds during the matchmaking process, but after about two minutes I was typically in. The player base is pretty dead now, so good luck finding anyone to play with. the gameplay itself is fun and strategic with what little it has, but it's become a broken mess of a game and shattered the large amount of potential it had going for it. Save yourself the money, cause there isn't any game to be seen here anymore.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe developers are selling in game stuff as microtransactions, so I'm considering this a complete product that they are selling on the open market, and will review it as such. You can't say it's early access if you are selling DLC and in-game stuff as microtransactions. The game has one gamemode, only one map, and only a handfull of different vessels. Every game is pretty much the same. You can't get into matches with your friends. Many critical functions are broken. This incoplete and buggy piece of junk is a lame excuse to sell DLC and microtransactions. Two thumbs down, this blows.
